alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Prince William, Manassas, Manassas Park; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 08 at 3:41PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Stafford and Central and Southeast Prince William/Manassas/Manassas Park Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 4 feet above normal. Moderate tidal flooding is possible along the Prince William and Stafford county coastlines during the Tuesday night high tide cycles.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Prince William, Manassas, Manassas Park; Stafford
